rules.6x6: Place a digit from 1 to 6 into each empty cell in the grid so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 2x3 outlined box. Each cross at the intersection of four cells indicates that the two pairs of diagonally opposite digits multiply to the same product. All possible crosses are marked.
rules.9x9: Place a digit from 1 to 9 into each empty cell in the grid so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 3x3 outlined box. Each cross at the intersection of four cells indicates that the two pairs of diagonally opposite digits multiply to the same product. All possible crosses are marked.
